qas.question: What does stong force act upon?
What can be seen between hadrons?
What is the force between nucleons?
What is the term for the lack of obsevable free quarks?
The weak force only acts on which particles?
The successful searches for what showed that the elementary particles are not observable?
The residual of what can be seen in front of hadrons?
The weak force acts upon what?

context: The strong force only acts directly upon <a0_0><a0_1><a0_2><a0_3><b5_0><b8_0>elementary<b5_0/> particles<b8_0/><a0_3/><a0_2/><a0_1/><a0_0/>. However, <a1_3>a <a1_0><a1_1>residual of <b7_0>the force<b7_0/><a1_3/><a1_1/><a1_0/> is observed between hadrons (the best known example being the force that acts between <a1_2>nucleons in atomic nuclei<a1_2/>) as the <a2_0><a2_1><a2_2><a2_3>nuclear<a2_2/><a2_0/> force<a2_3/>.<a2_1/> Here the strong force acts indirectly, transmitted <a3_0><a3_1><a3_2><a3_3>as gluons<a3_3/><a3_2/><a3_1/><a3_0/>, which form part of the virtual pi and rho mesons, which classically transmit the nuclear force (see this topic for more). The failure of many searches for <b6_0>free quarks<b6_0/> has shown that the elementary particles affected are not directly observable. This phenomenon is called <a4_0><a4_1><a4_2><a4_3>color confinement<a4_3/><a4_2/><a4_1/><a4_0/>.
